label: human
text: I couldn't believe what happened at the grocery store today. This old guy in front of me was arguing with the cashier about expired coupons — like, really going at it. Meanwhile, I'm standing there with my ice cream melting. Finally gave up and switched to self-checkout, which of course didn't work either because apparently I look underage when buying cooking wine. Some days, man.

label: human
text: My grandmother used to make this incredible chicken soup. She never wrote the recipe down, just threw things in — a handful of this, a pinch of that. I've been trying to recreate it for years. Got close last winter, I think. The trick might be the dill. She always grew it in her backyard, next to those ugly ceramic frogs she loved so much. God, I miss her.

label: human
text: So the meeting was a disaster. Tom showed up 20 minutes late, Jennifer's slides were from last quarter (she literally presented the wrong deck), and the client kept asking about deliverables we hadn't even discussed internally. I tried to pivot but honestly we just looked unprepared. Need to figure out damage control before the follow-up call Thursday.

label: human
text: The rain started around 3 am. I know because the gutter outside my window makes this horrible clanking noise when it rains hard. Couldn't fall back asleep. Ended up reading half a book — one of those detective novels my dad left behind. Not great literature but it did the job. By morning the rain had stopped but everything smelled like wet earth and possibility. Or maybe just wet earth.

label: human
text: Look, I'm not saying the movie was bad. It was fine. Perfectly fine. Good actors, decent script, nice cinematography. But did I feel anything? No. And that's the problem with so much stuff coming out now — it's all competent but nobody's taking real risks. Give me a messy, ambitious failure over a polished nothing any day. At least then you remember it.
